step1.sentence: The bold red poster on the wall caught my attention as I walked into the café.

step2.story: Emma was scrolling through her phone during the meeting when a sharp knock on the table caught her attention. She looked up to find her manager staring right at her. From that moment on, she kept her phone in her bag during work hours.

step3.story: Daniel had been working at the same company for three years without anyone noticing his talent. One Friday afternoon, he decided to present a side project he had been building on his own time. The clever dashboard design immediately caught the director's attention. She called him into her office the following Monday and asked him to lead a new product team. Daniel could hardly believe that one small demo had changed everything. Sometimes all it takes is a single moment to catch someone's attention and open an entirely new door.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 누군가의 주의를 '잡다(catch)'라는 뜻으로, 시선이나 관심을 사로잡는다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 것이 눈에 띄거나 흥미를 끌 때 사용합니다. 사람, 물건, 소리, 행동 등 다양한 주어가 올 수 있으며, 의도적으로 관심을 끄는 경우와 우연히 눈에 띄는 경우 모두에 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'catch'는 고대 프랑스어 'cachier(잡다)'에서 유래했으며, 물리적으로 무언가를 잡는 것에서 추상적으로 관심이나 시선을 사로잡는다는 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 격식·비격식 구분 없이 폭넓게 쓰이는 자연스러운 표현입니다. 긍정적·중립적 맥락에서 주로 사용하며, 부정적인 뉘앙스는 거의 없습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: A colorful sign outside the shop caught my attention.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 가게 밖의 화려한 간판이 내 시선을 끌었다.
